column1: #Text=of the United States had his first full interview since his inauguration , on Al Arabiya television .
#Text=The Dubai television network in the United Arab Emirates had exclusive access to the President .
#Text=Barack Obama in his historic interview on Al Arabia .
#Text=During the interview , Obama repeated a campaign promise to deliver a speech in a Muslim capital , and urged that the peace process between Israel and Palestine resume .
#Text=" We cannot tell either the Israelis or the Palestinians what 's best for them .

#Text=Obama also spoke about al-Qaeda and , according to Al Arabiya , former President George W. Bush ' s  war on terror " .

column1: #Text=" [ What ] we need to understand is , is that there are extremist organizations — whether Muslim or any other faith in the past — that will use faith as a justification for violence . Our administration [ will ] be very clear in distinguishing between organizations like al Qaeda — that espouse violence , espouse terror and act on it — and people who may disagree with my administration and certain actions .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=On the topic of Iran , Obama stated that the country has not been conducive to peace , and that ,  if countries like Iran are willing to unclench their fist , they will find an extended hand from us .

_	_	_	_

#Text= If we start the steady progress on these issues , I 'm absolutely confident that the United States , working in tandem with the European Union , with Russia , with all the Arab States in the region — I 'm absolutely certain that we can make significant progress , " Obama told the interviewer .

column1: #Text=Immediately prior to the interview , Obama met with George J. Mitchell , his special envoy to the Middle East .
#Text=Mitchell then embarked on his diplomatic mission with visits to Israel , the West Bank , Jordan , Egypt , Saudi Arabia , France and the United Kingdom .
